post.author: CrimsonHead
post.body: I like the Hud too, it's very immersive, it keeps you in the game at all times, I'm wondering how you tell your health status. Looks like a cool game I'm going to have to check it out in October, I'm getting a 360 this fall in preparation for the coming of RE5 anyhow so now I know what I'll do with it until then.

post.author: pbmax
post.body:
CrimsonHead wrote:
I'm wondering how you tell your health status.


since its in 3rd person, the player has a green glowing energy pack on his back that decreases as you get hurt. its basically a health bar on his back.

post.author: revility
post.body: reminds me of what a thirdperson doom would like with dismemberment. I believe its hitting the pc too.

post.author: CrimsonHead
post.body: I must have missed the part about it coming to PC too, I was thinking he said 360 and ps3 only. Yeah it really reminds me of if you took Doom³ and Resident Evil 4 and mixed them together you'd have this, those are two of my favorite games btw. One thing I might not enjoy though is that it might be a little frustrating working on one monster for 15 minutes just to kill him, I hope it will have some smaller "fodder" type enemies as well so not every single battle is like a boss battle.

post.author: chiapas
post.body:
That looks incredible. System Shock 2-ish, but updated to current tech. What I want to know is, what do people have against huds? Lately, the trend seems to be hud == bad. are huds going the way of the dodo and becoming a relic of old-skool gaming?

(he said it will be available on the 360, ps3, & PC on the 21st (what month, I don't know) )

post.author: CrimsonHead
post.body: I think Huds are right there in front reminding people that its just a game, sometimes I turn the Hud off in Doom³ and Prey while I'm playing and it just seems to take on a whole new level of realism, I can't really explain it but it does.
